item.title: 2nd Imaginary Matrix Shrimp Sushi Restaurant Contest
item.description: Imaginary Matrix $$ x^{2} = -1 \longrightarrow X^{2} = - E_{p} $$ The second contest addressed the Imaginary Matrix, a generalization of complex numbers to matrices as $\mathbb{R}^{p \times p}$. Results Participants included uriel, jryoungw, and Trakatus, with the scorecard available here. Research From the organizer’s perspective, a surprising aspect was the rapid rate of abstraction, sooner than expected. It was assumed that a winning strategy would involve initially exploring

item.title: 1st Shrimp Sushi Restaurant Competition: Graph Group
item.description: In 2022, Fresh Shrimp Sushi has launched a regular event in which readers can participate. Every quarter, one task is unveiled. This contest’s section focuses on Pure Mathematics, specifically on assigning operations to a set of graphs and exploring their structures. The expected difficulty level is suitable for 2nd to 3rd-year undergraduates. Graph Group Let’s represent the set of $n$ labeled simple

item.title: 2021 Reader Major Survey Results
item.description: Reader Survey Results The Shrimp Sushi House aims to be the largest formal science blog in the country, and in 2022, we are preparing events such as small competitions in conjunction with the community. From December 29th, 2020, to November 28th, 2021, for about 11 months, we have asked our visitors for a brief survey on their majors. Let’s look at a brief summary together. A total of 799 readers
